title: Emmanuel Rivière
text:
Emmanuel José Rivière (born 3 March 1990) is a Martiniquais professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a>. Rivière primarily plays in the <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29%23Striker">lead striker</a> role, but can also operate on the <a href="Midfielder%23Winger">wings</a>. He was a <a href="France%20national%20youth%20football%20team">French youth international</a> having played at all levels before switching to represent the <a href="Martinique%20national%20football%20team">Martinique national football team</a>.
Club career.
Early career.
Rivière began his football career playing on the French <a href="overseas%20department">overseas department</a> of <a href="Martinique">Martinique</a> playing for local side Espoir Sainte-Luce in the <a href="Communes%20of%20France">commune</a> of <a href="Sainte-Luce%2C%20Martinique">Sainte-Luce</a>. He attracted interest from French clubs on the mainland after his performances at the annual <a href="Coupe%20Nationale">Coupe Nationale</a> des 14 ans, which was held at the <a href="INF%20Clairefontaine">Clairefontaine academy</a>. Notable clubs that scouted him included <a href="Paris%20Saint-Germain%20F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a>, <a href="Olympique%20Lyonnais">Lyon</a> and Saint-Étienne. The player signed for Saint-Étienne citing the club's history stating, "The ASSE is legendary in Martinique. They're a very big club. My family was happy to see me sign here. My father, who follows a lot of football, talks about them often."
Saint-Étienne.
During his early years at the club, former Saint-Étienne <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> and fellow <a href="Martinique">Martiniquais</a> <a href="Fr%C3%A9d%C3%A9ric%20Piquionne">Frédéric Piquionne</a> served as a mentor. Rivière made his debut in the <a href="Championnat%20de%20France%20Amateurs">reserves</a> at the age of 16. During the summer of 2008, he signed his first professional contract agreeing to a three-year deal, which kept him with the <a href="Rh%C3%B4ne-Alpes">Rhône-Alpes</a>-based outfit until 2011.
For the duration of 2008, Rivière did not see any playing time with the senior team; he featured only in the reserves. He made his professional debut on 3 January 2009 in a <a href="Coupe%20de%20France">Coupe de France</a> match against <a href="FC%20Girondins%20de%20Bordeaux">Bordeaux</a>. He started the match and played the full 90 minutes with Saint-Étienne picking up a 1–0 victory courtesy of a goal from <a href="Baf%C3%A9timbi%20Gomis">Bafétimbi Gomis</a> in the 74th minute. He made his league debut on 31 January in a match against <a href="Derby%20du%20Rh%C3%B4ne">rivals</a> Lyon, coming on as a substitute in the 72nd minute; the match ended in a 1–1 draw. Rivière scored his first career goal for Saint-Étienne on 13 May 2009 in the club's 4–2 victory over <a href="Le%20Havre%20AC">Le Havre</a>.
Due to the departure of Gomis, injuries to strikers <a href="Ilan%20Ara%C3%BAjo%20Dall%27Igna">Ilan</a> and <a href="Kevin%20Mirallas">Kevin Mirallas</a>, and the late arrival of the <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="Gonzalo%20Rub%C3%A9n%20Bergessio">Gonzalo Bergessio</a>, Rivière started the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20in%20French%20football">2009–10 season</a> as the club's first choice <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>. On 15 August, Rivière netted his first goal of the season in the club's 3–1 loss to <a href="Toulouse%20FC">Toulouse</a>. Following the inclusion of Bergessio into the team, Rivière shifted to the <a href="Midfielder%23Winger">winger</a> role. On 9 January 2010, he scored the opening goal in Saint-Étienne's 4–1 <a href="Coupe%20de%20France">cup</a> victory over <a href="FC%20Lorient">Lorient</a>. The following week, he scored the <a href="game-winning%20goal">game-winning goal</a> in a 2–1 victory over <a href="Grenoble%20Foot%2038">Grenoble</a>. In February and March, Rivière performed valiantly, scoring five goals in seven matches and also assisting on a goal. Saint-Étienne only lost one of the seven matches played during the span, which lifted the club out of the relegation zone. Rivière scored opening goals in matches against Lyon and <a href="Lille%20OSC">Lille</a>, both of which ended in a draw, and scored the game-winning goal against <a href="Montpellier%20HSC">Montpellier</a>. On 5 May, Rivière netted another game-winning goal, this time against <a href="US%20Boulogne">Boulogne</a>. The 1–0 result assured Saint-Étienne another campaign in Ligue 1 and also relegated Boulogne.
On 22 July 2010, Rivière signed a three-year contract extension with Saint-Étienne until June 2014. Before signing the agreement, he drew interest from Ligue 1 club Toulouse and German club <a href="TSG%201899%20Hoffenheim">1899 Hoffenheim</a>.
Toulouse.
On 12 July 2011, French club Toulouse confirmed that Rivière had joined the club on a four-year contract from Saint-Étienne. The transfer fee was priced at €6 million.
Monaco.
On 30 January 2013, Rivière joined <a href="AS%20Monaco%20FC">Monaco</a> on a four-and-a-half-year contract for a fee reported to be around €4 million. He scored his first goal for Monaco on his debut in a 2–0 away win at <a href="AC%20Arles-Avignon">Arles</a> on 4 February 2013.
He scored in Monaco's first game back in <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Ligue%201">Ligue 1</a> on 10 August 2013, coming on for <a href="James%20Rodr%C3%ADguez">James Rodríguez</a> in the 72nd minute and scoring less than ten minutes later, helping the club to a 2–0 victory over Bordeaux. In Monaco's match against Montpellier on 18 August, he scored his first ever career hat-trick as the club eased to a 4–1 victory. He then went on to score against <a href="Olympique%20de%20Marseille">Marseille</a> on 1 September, coming off the bench to net the winning goal.
Newcastle United.
On 16 July 2014, Rivière joined <a href="Premier%20League">Premier League</a> side <a href="Newcastle%20United%20F.C.">Newcastle United</a>, signing a four-year contract for an undisclosed fee believed to be in the region of £6 million. He became manager <a href="Alan%20Pardew">Alan Pardew</a>'s fifth signing of the 2014 summer transfer window and upon joining the Tyneside club, Rivière spoke of his excitement of joining the club: "I'm very happy to be here at Newcastle. When the club spoke to me I said yes immediately. It was an easy decision because Newcastle is a big club with great fans and a good stadium."
He made his competitive debut on 17 August in Newcastle's opening match of the league season, a 2–0 defeat to <a href="Manchester%20City%20F.C.">Manchester City</a>; he was substituted for fellow debutant <a href="Ayoze%20P%C3%A9rez">Ayoze Pérez</a> after 83 minutes. His first goals for the club came on 24 September when he scored two goals, including a penalty, to help his side defeat <a href="Crystal%20Palace%20F.C.">Crystal Palace</a> 3–2 in the third round of the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Football%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a>. Rivière did not score in the league until 16 May, when he was set up by goalkeeper <a href="Tim%20Krul">Tim Krul</a> to open the scoring away at <a href="Queens%20Park%20Rangers%20F.C.">Queens Park Rangers</a>, with Newcastle eventually losing 1–2 to their already-relegated opponents at <a href="Loftus%20Road">Loftus Road</a>. This represented the player's solitary league goal for Newcastle.
Osasuna.
On 31 August 2016, Rivière was loaned to <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a> side <a href="CA%20Osasuna">CA Osasuna</a> for the 2016–17 season. He finished the season without scoring a goal and returned to Newcastle United at the end of the season.
Metz.
On 25 August 2017, Rivière completed a move to French <a href="Ligue%201">Ligue 1</a> club <a href="FC%20Metz">FC Metz</a>. He left the club at the end of the 2018–19 season.
Cosenza.
On 12 September 2019, Rivière signed a one-year contract with <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a> club <a href="Cosenza%20Calcio">Cosenza</a>.
Crotone.
On 11 September 2020, Rivière joined <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> club <a href="F.C.%20Crotone">Crotone</a> for free. He signed a 2-years contract. On 15 October 2021, Crotone announced that Rivière's contract was terminated by the club for the violation of said contract by the player, retroactively back from 13 August 2021.
